intro: Mentzelia urens, commonly known as the sticky evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Mentzelia urens thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
